prompt: I am making the move to New Jersey for a job promotion I recently received. I've pretty much lived in the Midwest most of my life and have limited knowledge and connections in NJ. I'm in my mid 20s and looking for somewhere safe, walkable, and with those that are of similar age so I can hopefully go out and meet people and have an access to a lot of social opportunities. Affordability would be a mega plus but the rental market seems to disagree with me a little bit on that one. I'm also working remotely so commuting is not a concern - although I will have a car to travel for client meetings. Would really appreciate any recommendations of areas to check out as I will be making a trip out to the area in a few weeks! Thanks so much!

prompt: Family moving from Northeast state to Alabama in the coming months. Son 1 will be attending college in AL so we have some skin in the game. We both work remotely and can work from anywhere. We are looking for homes/farms ~ 2500+ sq ft with more acreage (5+) for potentially owning horses and a bit of the off-grid feel. Schools are an obvious concern with son 2 (elementary) when looking at more rural areas. We grew up visiting the AL/FL beaches and we are looking forward to that again. We would prefer to be within reach of good hospitals, groceries, schools, etc. Any suggestions on areas that we should be focused on to research? and what challenges we may be faced with in those areas?

prompt: My family and I are looking to move to MI next summer but we don't know exactly where in the state we want to live. We plan on visiting a handful of towns before we settle down in one. We are fortunate enough that we can work from just about anywhere, so we are pretty open about location but do have a few requirements. It needs to be near water, like walking/short bike ride to a lake or nice river, would like a smaller population less than 30.000 would be ideal, needs shopping near by, rent needs to be cheap, the cheaper the better, low on crime and no prisons nearby (one of the major reasons we are leaving our current town) has nice parks, hiking, fishing, etc. We are just looking for a nice community to raise our family. So, where would be your ideal place to live? What places stand out to you?
rec_reasons1: Proximity to Lake Michigan, quiet community, affordable housing, excellent schools;Charming downtown, close to Sleeping Bear Dunes National Lakeshore, affordable cost of living;Rich in history and culture, close to University of Michigan-Flint, diverse population;Beautiful beaches and sunsets, affordable rentals, close to several state parks;Affordable waterfront living, close to several islands, abundant fishing and boating opportunities
rec_reasons2: Affordable living, access to multiple rivers, close to major cities like Grand Rapids and Kalamazoo;Small-town charm, friendly residents, excellent schools;Rich in history and culture, close to several waterfalls and hiking trails;Safe neighborhoods, low crime rate, close to several parks and green spaces;Proximity to Lake Michigan, access to several islands
rec_reasons3: Charming downtown, close to both Lake Michigan and the Huron River, affordable housing options;Rich in history and culture, close to several museums and historical sites;Safe neighborhoods, low crime rate, excellent schools;Proximity to several state parks and forests;Affordable living compared to other parts of Michigan
rec_reasons4: Beautiful beaches and sunsets, affordable rentals, close to several state parks;Proximity to both Lake Michigan and the Kalamazoo River, access to several islands;Safe neighborhoods, low crime rate, excellent schools;Affordable housing options;Rich in history and culture
rec_reasons5: Affordable waterfront living, close to several islands, abundant fishing and boating opportunities;Proximity to both Lake Michigan and the Maumee River, access to several waterfalls and hiking trails;Safe neighborhoods, low crime rate, excellent schools;Rich in history and culture;Close to several state parks and forests

prompt: Coming to Arkansas for family vacation, things to see and do? We originally decided we wanted to go to the Crater of Diamonds State park, and the birthplace of Bill Clinton, and check out Little Rock. What else should we see that I won't find on the top 10 lists on travel sites? 2 Adults and a 6 yr old boy who loves caves and rocks and dirt. The Adults enjoy history and nature. Thanks in advance for helping out a family of cheese heads from Wisconsin.
rec_reasons1: Unique rock formations and abundant fossils;Rich history as a center of the Ozark Mountains;Proximity to Buffalo National River
rec_reasons2: Known as the 'Cave City of the World', with over 125 caves to explore;Rich Native American heritage;Scenic Ozark Mountains scenery
rec_reasons3: Historic downtown area and rich Civil War history;Home to the Ozark Folk Festival;Close to Buffalo National River and Kings River Cave
rec_reasons4: Known for its outdoor recreation opportunities and proximity to Fayetteville;Rich in Civil War history;Home to the University of Arkansas
rec_reasons5: Rich in history and known for its beautiful scenery;Close to Caddo Lake State Park;Known for its gemstone mining and local gemstone shops
